SubTopics: Describe the origins and central features of Islam.
Content: Which statement explains the historical significance of the Qur'an?

A.Choice: It is an ancient text for the Shinto religion.

B.Choice: It is part of traditional beliefs of Judaism.

C.Choice: It is part of the core belief system of Buddhism.

D.Choice: It is the foundational text for the religion of Islam.

Topics: Middle Ages In Western Europe (400-1500s CE)
SubTopics: Analyze the importance of the Black Death on the emergence of a modern economy.
Content: Use the selection of causes and effects to complete the diagram.
problems/TN19G7SS/media/2a.jpg
Which diagram shows the correctly placed causes and effects?

SubTopics: Analyze Johannes Gutenberg's printing press and William Tyndale's translation of the Bible into the English language as vehicles for the spread of books, growth of literacy, and dissemination of knowledge.
Content: Look at the image and answer the question.
problems/TN19G7SS/media/3a.jpg
Which statement analyzes the effect that the technology shown in this image had in Western Europe?

A.Choice: Ancient texts became more difficult to obtain.

B.Choice: Monasteries were built to expand religious authority.

C.Choice: Books became more expensive to produce.

D.Choice: Bibles became available in different languages.

SubTopics: Explain the development of Renaissance art.
Content: Read the list and answer the question.

:ibox:• Introduced a new style of poetry by developing the blank verse

• Introduced new vocabulary and phrases to the English language

• Helped contribute to the standardization of the English language
Which figure is BEST described by this list?

SubTopics: Describe Prince Henry the Navigator's influence on exploration, voyages, cartographic improvements, and tools related to exploration (i.e., compass, caravel, astrolabe, and Harrison's chronometer) during the Age of Discovery.
Content: How did the astrolabe contribute to the expansion of the European worldview?

A.Choice: by helping navigate ships during exploration

B.Choice: by providing atmospheric pressure readings to explorers

C.Choice: by calculating the distance between locations for land surveyors

D.Choice: by allowing cartographers to accurately measure ocean currents

SubTopics: Describe Kublai Khan's conquest of China, and explain how he was able to maintain control of the Yuan Empire.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:ibox:I have found the earliest illustration of a cannon in the world, which dates from ... around 1127, which was 150 years before the development of the cannon in the West. The Song ... use of gunpowder was the reason it was able to hold off the Mongols for many decades... After the introduction of the cannon and gunpowder to the West, Westerners very quickly became expert with cannons. They cast bronze cannons that were eventually much better than those the Chinese could produce.

	— Robin D. S. Yates, McGill University
Based on the source, which statement summarizes a significance of China's development of gunpowder during the Song dynasty?

A.Choice: The Chinese invention led to a military alliance with Japan.

B.Choice: China used the technology primarily for nonmilitary purposes.

C.Choice: The Chinese invention influenced new technologies in Europe.

D.Choice: Europeans kept the invention secret in order to defend against China.

Content: Study the diagram and answer the question.

A.Choice: Centered on the Amazon rain forest

D.Choice: Economic system based on raising cattle

Topics: Middle Ages In Western Europe (400-1500s CE)
SubTopics: Describe the development of feudalism and manorialism, their role in the medieval European economy, and the way in which they were influenced by physical geography (i.e., the role of the manor and the growth of towns).
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:ibox:The steward [manager] ought, on his coming to each manor, to see and inquire how they are tilled, and in what crops they are, and how the cart-horses and avers [cattle], oxen, cows, sheep, and swine [pigs] are kept and improved. And if there be loss or damage from want of guard [lack of security], he ought to take fines from those who are to blame, so that the lord may not lose.

	— The Seneschaucy (Rules of Husbandry), England, c. 1275
Which statement about manorialism and its role in the medieval economy is supported by this source?

A.Choice: The nobles' wealth came from the labor of the peasants.

B.Choice: Kings became less able to protect nobles' lands against invasions.

C.Choice: The leaders of the church held more authority than nobles.

D.Choice: Cities lost their importance as nobles became more powerful.

SubTopics: Describe how the Aztec and Inca empires were eventually defeated by Spanish Conquistadors (i.e., Hernan Cortes and Francisco Pizarro).
Content: Look at the graphic organizer and answer the question.
problems/TN19G7SS/media/10a.jpg
Which statement correctly completes the graphic organizer?

A.Choice: The arrival of the Spanish led to the formation of a feudal society in the Aztec Empire.

B.Choice: The Spanish established overseas trade networks with the Aztec Empire.

C.Choice: The arrival of the Spanish led to the downfall of the Aztec Empire.

D.Choice: The Spanish signed a military alliance with the Aztec Empire.

SubTopics: Explain the impact of the Columbian Exchange on people, plants, animals, technology, culture, ideas, and diseases among Europe, Africa, Asia, and the Americas in the 15th and 16th centuries, and examine the major economic and social effects on each continent.
Content: Look at the map and answer the question.
problems/TN19G7SS/media/11a.jpg
How did this exchange affect American Indians?

SubTopics: Explain the political and religious roles of Henry VIII and Mary I in England's transition between Catholicism and Protestantism.
Content: Read the list and answer the question.

:ibox:Reformation in England

• King Henry VIII sought to remarry.

• King Henry VIII established the Church of England.

• King Henry VIII sold Catholic Church property.
Which statement explains how these events contributed to the weakening of the Catholic Church?

A.Choice: The Church of England spread into France.

B.Choice: The Catholic Church was unable to sell indulgences in Spain.

C.Choice: The Church of England worked with other nations for religious change.

D.Choice: The Catholic Church lost political influence over this king.

SubTopics: Summarize agricultural, commercial, and technological developments during the Song Dynasties, and describe the role of Confucianism during the Song.
Content: Read the list and answer the question.

:ibox:Rice Cultivation during the Song Dynasty

• New strains of rice were used.

• Improved methods of irrigation were developed.

• Rice growing areas became the centers of economic growth.
Why were the technologies described in the list so important to the Song Dynasty?

A.Choice: Mountainous terrain improved access to foreign goods.

B.Choice: Higher farm productivity was needed to sustain an expanding civilization.

C.Choice: Desert conditions improved access to rivers for the growth of crops.

D.Choice: Taxes on foreign agricultural products led to food shortages.
